Description: Scarab carved from light brown steatite; back crudely detailed with only clypeus and head marked; at side, legs only indicated by two horizontal grooves; underside inscribed with hieroglyphs arranged vertically: sun-disc flanked by uraeus to the top, men-draughtboard sign in the middle and shield sign (usually used to write the name of the goddess Neith) flanked by addorsed yod, underneath; longitudinally pierced.
Curator's comments: Though the hieroglyphic signs have often just some magical value, it seems plausible that this is a cryptographic reading for the name of Amun, maybe associated with the name of Neith (on the cryptic writing of the name of Amun: Drioton 1957). The shield sign can appear in trigrams of Amun (Hornung and Staehelin 1976, 309, pl. 67, no. 596). Drioton, E. 1957, 'Trigrammes d'Amon', Festschrift Hermann Junker zum 80. Geburtstag (Wiener Zeitschrift für die Kunde des Morgenlandes 54), Wien, 11-33. Hornung, E., Staehelin, E. 1976. Skarabäen und andere Siegelamulette aus Basler Sammlungen, Ägyptische Denkmäler in der Schweiz I, Mainz. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXVIII, no. 191)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OA.79) (phase 3)
